alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Delaware (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 8:33AM EST until March 15 at 1:32AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Indiana and east central Indiana, including the following counties, in central Indiana, Decatur, Hancock, Madison, Rush and Shelby. In east central Indiana, Delaware, Henry and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 AM EST, River gauge reports indicate rises on area creeks and streams due to heavy rain yesterday. Flooding continues on waterways in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muncie, Anderson, New Castle, Rushville, Winchester, Adams, Yorktown, Chesterfield, Knightstown, Daleville, Parker City, Farmland, Geneva, Lynn, St. Paul, Carthage, Spiceland, Selma, Shirley and Markleville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
